title: Bug 47910: ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: The current behavior is that when using ajc to create a .jar file with the outjar option, the generated .jar file does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file. This is problematic because a .jar file without a manifest is not considered a valid JAR file.
OB: When I call ajc with the sourceroots option, pointing to a directory, and the outjar option, specifying a file name with a .jar extension, an output file is created. However, when I examine the generated file, it does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
EB: I expect that when I use ajc with the outjar option, the generated .jar file should contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, perform the following steps:
1. Use the ajc compiler with the sourceroots option to specify a source directory.
2. Include the outjar option in the command, specifying a file name with a .jar extension.
3. Verify the contents of the generated .jar file and confirm that it does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
